About

Hello there! I'm Brittany.

Nice to meet you. I’m an alumna of the beautiful University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. I was a student in the School of Media and Journalism, and now I'm on to my next big step living full-time in the greater D.C. area.

Code is something I love, and I'm lucky that I get to do it everyday. I'm pursuing a job in news as an interactive graphics or news apps developer. Until then, I've been doing some contract and temp work.

I'm passionate, inquisitive and enthusiastic. I never want to stop learning. So that was a little about me. I'd love to hear from you.

Résumé

Experience

  • June 2016-August 2016

    NPR Code/Design Intern

    The visuals team is the core of the photography, daily graphics and data applications of the organization. The team also works to produce open source tools used throughout NPR’s member stations and beyond.

    • Produced quick, accurate breaking news graphics to accompany reporter coverage
    • Collect and analyze data for visualization
    • Collaborate on interactive news graphics and applciations
    • Detailed best practices to explain the clean, easy-to-read code for open sourcing.

  • May 2016-June 2016

    NYTSJI Digital Editor

    The NYTSJI is a two-week program for student journalists in NABJ and NAHJ. Students work alongside NYT reporters and editors to produce a working newsroom.

    • Managed web content, added custom page layouts and worked on theme template for NYC16.nytimes-institute.com.
    • Produced data visualization to accompany featured articles.

  • January 2016-May 2016

    Undercurrent Manager/Lead Developer

    Undercurrent is an interactive documentary project showing the intersection of the culture and environment of Bocas del Toro.

    • Oversaw the production and content collection of the site, Undercurrent360.com.
    • Corresponded with the videographers, reporters, developers, designers and coaches for a cohesive workflow.
    • Worked with a designer to develop an interactive graphic for the story "A Sea for My Children."

  • January 2015-May 2016

    ViewMedica Part Time Web Designer

    Swarm Interactive specializes in medical motion graphics and website development.

    • Maintained hundreds of practice websites.
    • Builds clean, professional, custom-designed and fully responsive sites using WordPress and Joomla.

Stand At The Edge Of Geologic Time

July 20, 2016

Over the past couple of months, NPR has done a variety of work on national parks. This is a virtual reality experience that takes the viewers to the Rocky Mountain National Park.

This VR project is the first of it’s kind for NPR. It emphasizes a combination of sound and environment to give an immersive experience.

  • Project: Stand At The Edge Of Geological Time
  • Role: Front end web developer
  • Code: Github Repository
  • Tools:
    • HTML/CSS
    • Less
    • JavaScript/jQuery
    • A-frame.js

In Recent Years Police Shootings In Dallas Have Fallen

July 8, 2016

In wake of the recent events in Dallas, Texas, NPR investigated the change in Dallas PD tactics in handling confrontation and excessive force. As shown in the graphic, Dallas police shootings have declined over the past years. Ted Robbins reports for NPR on the police in Dallas.

  • Article: In Recent Years, Police Shootings In Dallas Have Fallen
  • Role: Data developer
  • Code: Github Repository
  • Data: Dallas police shootings
  • Tools:
    • HTML/CSS
    • Less
    • D3.js

The 270 Project

July 7, 2016

For in depth coverage and analysis of the U.S. election, we decided to make an interactive slider for a basis to show how the numbers of the election can be manipulated to favor one of the two major parties.

The reporter, NPR’s Asma Khalid, used the interactive to perform some crazy number-crunching and produced an in-depth analysis of what it would take to get Trump to the White House.

  • Article: The 270 Project: Try To Predict Who Will Win The Election
  • Role: Developer and designer
  • Code: Github Repository
  • Data: Trump 270, adjustable version
  • Tools:
    • HTML/CSS
    • Less
    • Ractive.js

Semi Automatic Weapons Without A Background Check Can Be Just A Click Away

June 17, 2016

In reaction to the Orlando shooting on June 12, 2016, NPR produced exclusive online content about the availability of guns through third-party sites like Armslist.com. For this piece, I co-wrote a python script to scrape the listings of the site back 90 days. We collected various information including location, price, and gun type. We then used it to make a data-driven piece and to create several data visualizations showing the hotspots in gun sales on the site and the number of guns sold per state.

  • Article: Semi-Automatic Weapons Without A Background Check Can Be Just A Click Away
  • Role: Data developer
  • Code: Github Repository
  • Data: Armslist Listings
  • Tools:
    • HTML/CSS
    • Less
    • JavaScript and jQuery

The New York Times Student Journalism Institute

June 4, 2016

The NYTSJI is a two-week fellowship program for 26 student journalists in NABJ and NAHJ. The Institute was held from May 20 to June 4, 2017, at the CUNY Graduate School of Journalism in New York City. Students formed a working newsroom side-by-side with the guidance of journalists from CUNY and the NYT.

As digital editor, I built out the WordPress site template, produced the online content and created data visualizations. During my time, I developed my php skills, learned Flexbox and collected and analyzed demographic data.

  • Fellowship: New York Times Student Journalism Institute
  • Role: Web Editor and Developer
  • Tools:
    • HTML/CSS
    • Design UX + UI
    • Data Wrangling
    • PHP

Undercurrent

May 13, 2016

For an international documentary project, a team of student videographers, reporters, developers and designers travelled to Bocas del Toro, Panama to tell the stories of the intersection of culture and environment.

The project includes a combination of 5 short documentaries, interactive graphics, articles and 360 videos!

Undercurrent proudly received the Excellence and Innovation in Visual Digital Storytelling award at the 2016 Online Journalism Awards.

  • Project: Undercurrent
  • Role: Project manager and lead developer
  • Tools:
    • HTML/CSS
    • Sass
    • JavaScript and jQuery
